intro: Epipactis microphylla var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and pale green to white flowers with a distinct lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It is a perennial species with a rhizomatous root system, and it produces a single spike of flowers. The variety glabrescens is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, giving it a more compact appearance compared to other varieties.
